lessons.japanese: よい隣人は遠くの親戚よりよい、という趣旨の格言がある。
lessons.indonesian: We have a saying to the effect that a good neighbor is better than a faraway relative.

lessons.japanese: 彼女は彼がすぐに帰るという趣旨の手紙を受け取った。
lessons.indonesian: She received the letter to the effect that he would soon be back.

lessons.japanese: 彼は私に会えないという趣旨の手紙を私によこした。
lessons.indonesian: He sent me a letter saying that he could not see me.

lessons.japanese: 彼は給食を食べに行くという趣旨のメモを残した。
lessons.indonesian: He left a note to the effect that he was going out for lunch.

lessons.japanese: 彼は愛していると言う趣旨の手紙を彼女に書いた。
lessons.indonesian: He wrote her to the effect that he loved her.

lessons.japanese: 彼が言った事はそれと反対の趣旨だった。
lessons.indonesian: What he said was to the contrary.

lessons.japanese: 読書するには趣旨をくみ取ることが必要だ。
lessons.indonesian: When you read a book you should read between the lines.

lessons.japanese: 政府は税金を値上げするという趣旨で発表を行った。
lessons.indonesian: The government made an announcement to the effect that taxes would be raised.

lessons.japanese: 私の申し出に応じられないという趣旨の手紙を彼から受け取った。
lessons.indonesian: I received a letter from him to the effect that he could not accept my offer.

lessons.indonesian: We have a saying to the effect that a good neighbor is better than a faraway relative.

lessons.indonesian: The government made an announcement to the effect that taxes would be raised.
